statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Bucknell 83, Cornell 39
article.story: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP) -- Chris McNaughton's spinning baseline layup sparked a 20-0 first-half run and freshman Jason Vegotsky had a career-high 12 points as Bucknell defeated Cornell 83-39 on Saturday. Bucknell (6-1) shot 61 percent as 12 of 13 players that saw court time scored for the Bison. McNaughton had 12 points while Kevin Bettencourt and Abe Badmus each chipped in 11. Cornell (3-6) struggled offensively, shooting just 26 percent, and fell to 0-5 on the road this year. It's also the third game this season that Cornell failed to score 50 points. With the game tied at 10, Bucknell knocked down several wide-open 3-point shots, quickly extending its lead to 30-10. Adam Gore's 3-pointer at the 6:18 mark broke Cornell's scoring drought, which spanned more than seven minutes. Gore finished with 9 points, shooting just 2 of 8 from 3-point range. Lenny Collins led the Big Red with 12 points. Leading 39-17, Bucknell closed out the first half with a 12-0 run as Vegotsky's 3-pointer from the top of the key gave the Bison a 51-17 advantage. Bucknell pulled down as many rebounds (17) as Cornell had points in the first half. Bucknell maintained a comfortable lead throughout the second half, as Cornell could not come any closer than 31 points. The Bison improved to 6-1 for the first time since 1983-84.
